description: Study of the Earth, its rocks, and its history.

slides.title: What is Geology?
slides.content:
# Earth Science ü™®

The study of solid Earth, the rocks of which it is composed, and the processes by which they change over time.
- **Physical Geology**: Processes (Volcanoes, Earthquakes).
- **Historical Geology**: Timeline (Fossils, Evolution).

slides.title: Structure of the Earth
slides.content:
# Layers üßÖ

1. **Crust**: Thin outer skin (Oceanic & Continental).
2. **Mantle**: Thick, flowing solid (Magma).
3. **Outer Core**: Liquid Iron/Nickel (Generates magnetic field).
4. **Inner Core**: Solid Iron (Hotter than sun's surface).

slides.title: Plate Tectonics
slides.content:
# Moving Puzzle üß©

The lithosphere is broken into plates that float on the mantle.
- **Divergent**: Moving apart (Mid-Atlantic Ridge).
- **Convergent**: Crashing (Himalayas).
- **Transform**: Sliding (San Andreas Fault).

slides.title: Continental Drift
slides.content:
# Pangea üó∫Ô∏è

Proposed by Alfred Wegener (1912).
- Continents fit like puzzle pieces.
- Fossils found on separated continents.
- Initially rejected, now accepted as Plate Tectonics.

slides.title: Rock Cycle
slides.content:
# Recycling ‚ôªÔ∏è

Rocks endlessly change form.
1. **Igneous**: Melts & Cools.
2. **Sedimentary**: Erodes & Cements.
3. **Metamorphic**: Heat & Pressure.
No rock is permanent!

slides.title: Rock Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which rock type is formed from cooling magma?

slides.title: Igneous Rocks
slides.content:
# Fire Rocks üî•

- **Intrusive**: Cooled slowly underground (Granite). Large crystals.
- **Extrusive**: Cooled quickly on surface (Basalt, Obsidian). Small/No crystals.

slides.title: Sedimentary Rocks
slides.content:
# Layers üç∞

Formed from sand, mud, and organic matter compressed over time.
- **Sandstone**: From sand.
- **Limestone**: From shells/coral.
- Only type that contains **Fossils**.

slides.title: Metamorphic Rocks
slides.content:
# Changed Form ü¶ã

Rocks altered by extreme heat/pressure (without melting).
- Limestone $\to$ Marble.
- Shale $\to$ Slate.
- Granite $\to$ Gneiss.

slides.title: Volcanoes
slides.content:
# Earth's Vents üåã

- **Shield**: Gentle lava flow (Hawaii).
- **Composite (Stratovolcano)**: Explosive (St. Helens, Fuji).
- **Caldera**: Collapsed giant (Yellowstone).
Lava cools into new land.

slides.title: Earthquakes
slides.content:
# Shaking Ground üìâ

Sudden release of energy in crust.
- **Focus**: Origin point underground.
- **Epicenter**: Point on surface above focus.
- Measured by **Richter Scale** (Logarithmic: 7 is 10x stronger than 6).

slides.title: Minerals
slides.content:
# Building Blocks üíé

Natural, inorganic solids with crystal structure.
- **Hardness**: Mohs Scale (Talc=1, Diamond=10).
- **Luster**: Shiny?
- **Cleavage**: How it breaks.
Rocks are made of minerals.

slides.title: Mineral Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the hardest natural mineral on Mohs scale?

slides.title: Weathering vs Erosion
slides.content:
# Breaking Down üåßÔ∏è

- **Weathering**: Breaking rocks *in place* (Rust, Freeze-thaw).
- **Erosion**: Moving the pieces away (Water, Wind, Ice).

slides.title: Geologic Time
slides.content:
# Deep Time ‚è≥

Earth is 4.54 Billion years old.
- **Eons** $\to$ **Eras** $\to$ **Periods**.
- **Precambrian**: 88% of history (Single cells).
- **Phanerozoic**: Visible life (Paleozoic, Mesozoic, Cenozoic).

slides.title: Fossils
slides.content:
# Stone Bones ü¶¥

Preserved remains of ancient life.
- **Body Fossils**: Bones, Shells.
- **Trace Fossils**: Footprints, Burrows.
- **Index Fossils**: Used to date rock layers (Trilobites).

slides.title: Soil
slides.content:
# Dirt ü™¥

Mixture of weathered rock and organic matter (Humus).
- Supports all plant life.
- Takes centuries to form 1 inch.
- Horizon layers: O (Organic), A (Topsoil), B (Subsoil), C (Parent).

slides.title: Groundwater
slides.content:
# Hidden Water üíß

Water stored in **Aquifers** (porous rock).
- **Water Table**: Top level of saturation.
- Cave formation (Karst topography) happens when acid water dissolves limestone.

slides.title: Geology Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Earth is active (**Tectonics**).
- Rocks cycle (**Igneous/Sedimentary/Metamorphic**).
- **Time** is vast.
- Landscape is shaped by build-up (Volcanoes) and wear-down (Erosion).
